page.title: 03Government Water supply
page.content: This block contains five reservoirs covering approximately one square kilometre in area. These are Digley, Bilberry, Brownhill, Ramesden and part of Riding Wood. All are maintained and administered by the Yorkshire Water Authority. Digley is the most recently constructed and was completed in 1953. It is 800m long, 400m wide at its widest and is approximately 45m deep in places. It disperses 2,855,000 gallons of water each day and supplies much of the Huddersfield area. The main pipeline is 10km long and 60cm in diameter. It cost Â£472,000 to build. Additional work has increased this sum to Â£1,185,277. All of the reservoirs have woodland plantations around them. All are coniferous and the most common species are spruce and larch.
